intro: Hieracium wiesbaurianum subsp. pseudowiesbaurianiforme, commonly known as the false Wiesbaur's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in rocky or sandy areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
